required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PIONEER Study of Lifestyle Intervention to Reduced Breast Cancer Risk
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot of Lifestyle InterventiON to reducE brEast Cancer RiSk (PIONEER)

collaborator.agency: National Institute for Health Research, United Kingdom

brief_summary.textblock:
A randomised controlled trial in which women discharged from the symptomatic breast clinic, who are above population risk (according to Tyrer Cuzick) will be asked to create lifestyle related goals. They will be told their estimated risk of developing breast cancer and will be randomised to one of three interventions:
- Breast cancer risk leaflet only
- lifestyle website
- lifestyle website plus group coaching.
Fifty per cent of women will also be randomised to have Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (SNPs) performed, and these will be incorporated into their risk score.
The primary end point will be whether or not women achieve their lifestyle goal.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Women will be asked this 12 months after entering the study
primary_outcome.description: Whether women have achieved their lifestyle goals. Proportion answering "yes" to a binary question: Did you achieve the goal you set? Compared between the three arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the acceptability of women to find out their personalised breast cancer risk and to commit to making a change in a modifiable risk factor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured when recruitment is complete, estimated at 3 months from start date
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of women approached who go on to join the study

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the acceptability of randomisation to different arms of intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured when the final participant has completed 12 months in the study, estimated 15 months from start date
secondary_outcome.description: Attrition rate after randomisation within each group

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the impact of SNP testing on changes in behavioural risk factors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured when the final participant has completed 12 months in the study estimated 15 months from start date
secondary_outcome.description: Goal achievement in SNP group compared with goal achievement in non-SNP group.

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the impact of the different interventions on changes in behavioural risk factors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured when the final participant has completed 12 months in the study estimated 15 months from start date
secondary_outcome.description: Goal achievement compared between leaflet only group, website group and website + coaching group.

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the impact of knowledge of breast cancer risk on cancer anxiety scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured when the final participant has completed 12 months in the study estimated 15 months from start date
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Cancer Worry Scale (Revised) score from 0 to 3 months. Cancer Worry score is measured between 8 and 32 with 32 being the highest level of anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: To identify whether there is an association between initial Cancer Worry Scale (Revised) score and change in behavioural risk factors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured when the final participant has completed 12 months in the study estimated 15 months from start date
secondary_outcome.description: Cancer Worry score compared with goal achievement. Cancer Worry score is between 8 and 32 with 32 being the highest level of anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: To identify whether commitment to a study of this design is sustainable and affected by study group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured when the final participant has completed 12 months in the study estimated 15 months from start date

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the impact of the different interventions on uptake and adherence to chemoprevention at 1 year
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured when the final participant has completed 12 months in the study estimated 15 months from start date
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of women still taking chemoprevention at close of study compared between the three arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: To consider the scalability of each element of the pilot study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured when the final participant has completed 12 months in the study estimated 15 months from start date
secondary_outcome.description: Administration time required for each group; Average goal achievement compared to average cost of each intervention.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Breast cancer risk leaflet PLUS SNPs
Lifestyle website PLUS group coaching PLUS SNPs

intervention.intervention_name: Lifestyle intervention to reduce breast cancer risk
intervention.description: Women will be educated about lifestyle factors which increase breast cancer risk. They will also be guided through an online goal setting process.
intervention.arm_group_label: Lifestyle website PLUS group coaching PLUS SNPs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- Aged between 30 and 60 years
- Attending the symptomatic breast clinic at RMH Sutton
- Benign or B3 diagnosis
- Agree to receive their personalised breast cancer risk
- Available to participate in a 1 year risk prevention programme
Exclusion Criteria:
- Malignant Diagnosis
- Does not want to find out personalised breast cancer risk
- Not available to participate for the full year
- NOTE: after risk assessment, women who have a breast cancer risk lower than that of population level will be excluded from participating in the behavioural change elements.

facility.name: The Royal Marsden Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
